channel.title: Key functions server side?
channel.description:
http://www.google.com/forums/showthread.php?59098-Proper-F-Keys-For-People-Who-Need-Them-PI-Version
Change google to rlocus site idk if im not aloud to post link but its for helping purposes
So i looked at this tutorial above and its adding the key functions on the client side but i was wondering if it was possible to add the key functions on server side so i can make the player do certain actions when pressing the key function rather than switching the tabs

item.title: Key functions server side?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:545946”]Look in your client.java.
search for the packet 185. Can probably just search “(185)” no quotes.
it should give you an idea.[/quote]

okay ive been searching around my files

i am using code in client that says “player currently has” amount of money "in money pouch"
and the amount of money is from the server and i found out where
so thats doing the opposite of what i need, its sending data from server to client and i need client to server
so i found the sendpacket185

public void sendPacket185(int button,int toggle,int type) {

so would i make something new like
public void sendPacket201(int keycode,int keychar) {

i know what i typed above isnt perfect but im rushing cuz i have to go to work so yea haha would i do something like that?

Read full topic

item.title: Key functions server side?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Look in your client.java.
search for the packet 185. Can probably just search “(185)” no quotes.
it should give you an idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Key functions server side?
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545946”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=664838.msg4444381#msg4444381 date=1408039040]

This is almost literally like what I just said in the last post.
You ‘could’ but it would really bog down the server.

Because you’d have to send every key command to the server (from every client) and handle it, then send the data back to the client.

how would i go about sending the key command to the server?
[/quote]
It would depend on your client and where you put that code he gave you.

But basically, open a stream. Send the information in a packet, read it on the server.[/quote]

im using deathlypvpz 317 pi

so how would i open a stream?

Read full topic

item.title: Key functions server side?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:3, topic:545946”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664838.msg4444378#msg4444378 date=1408038452]
This is almost literally like what I just said in the last post.
You ‘could’ but it would really bog down the server.

Because you’d have to send every key command to the server (from every client) and handle it, then send the data back to the client.
[/quote]

how would i go about sending the key command to the server?[/quote]
It would depend on your client and where you put that code he gave you.

But basically, open a stream. Send the information in a packet, read it on the server.

Read full topic
